word_mean: 瘴毒，瘴气：疑为土壤散发出来的毒气，在真正病因查明前，曾认为是某些地方流行病(例如疟疾)的病因。见tellurism
中国南方山林荒野特有的病邪之统称，包括疟邪等。

sentence.Network_en: A miasma of stale alcohol hung around him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他身上老有股难闻的酒精味。

sentence.Network_en: As time went on, his ambition to be part of the US Supreme Court faded in a miasma of alcohol and despair.
sentence.Network_cn: 随着时间的推移，他跻身美国最高法院的雄心壮志在弥漫着酒精和绝望气息的乌烟瘴气中消失殆尽。

sentence.Network_en: A miasma rose from the marsh.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Greek, literally defilement', from miainein 'pollute'

entry.def: You can describe something bad or confused that seems to be in the air all around you as a miasma .

example.ex: As time went on, his ambition to be part of the US Supreme Court faded in a miasma of alcohol and despair.
example.tran: 随着时间的推移，他跻身美国最高法院的雄心壮志在弥漫着酒精和绝望气息的乌烟瘴气中消失殆尽。

sentences.sentence: "the novel spun a miasma of death and decay"

means.word_mean: 2. unhealthy vapors rising from the ground or other sources;
